social_posts.post_text:
✨New Restaurant✨
Gorgeous new sushi date night spot in River Oaks from the owners of Bosscat Kitchen! 

TEN Sushi + Cocktail Bar is located just off Westheimer at Mid Lane, across the street from Bosscat. The restaurant is gorgeous, with pink Sakura branches, hanging lanterns, intimate banquettes and a sexy bar area. 

The restaurant concept comes from Newport Beach, with a huge menu of fusion-style appetizers, entrees, composed sashimi dishes, nigiri and rolls. 

Start with their chili garlic edamame, add a sashimi dish like the yuzu salmon or halibut sea salt, try some nigiri (we had o-toro, scallop, hamachi, amaebi, uni), add a roll to share, then finish strong with an entree like the Vietnamese Shaken beef, served over garlic noodles - winning! The restaurant is not strictly Japanese, blending flavors from East and Southeast Asia in dishes that are designed for sharing. 

A perfect date night spot (I spied lots of couples) or GNO! Cocktails are fab and service was excellent. Our server, Cole, looked like younger version of actor Henry Cavill. Thanks to @sushibylionel and the team for the great hospitality! 
📍TEN Sushi + Cocktail Bar
@tensushihtx 
4200 Westheimer Rd
Houston, TX 77027

✨White Truffle Pasta✨
White Alba Truffle Season is here! The season is super short so get it while you can! Now available @aaronbludorn’s hot new Rice Village restaurant, @navybluehtx!!! 

This is true white glove service. The white truffles arrive at the table in a small silver globe. Then they are shaved over your choice of spaghetti or risotto, with the option of a half or full order. The aromas are to die for. White truffle season will end by early/mid January so now is the time #justdoit
📍Navy Blue
2445 Times Blvd
Houston, TX 77005

✨New Restaurant✨
Houston, we’ve got a hot one! @aaronbludorn’s new restaurant in the Rice Village is a stone cold stunner. The seafood-focused restaurant is turning out delicious dishes that are familiar but done with a gourmet chef’s touch: baked clams, fantastic gulf coast crab cake, knock-your-socks-off boneless Branzino, and what will undoubtedly be the signature mussel bisque topped with a croissant-like puff pastry shell. There’s a gorgeous bar, fab cocktails, excellent wine list, delicious deserts, and top notch service. Three weeks in, the experience is very impressive! We tried a bunch of things but barely scratched the surface. Can’t wait to go back! Currently open for dinner, with lunch service to come in the new year. Reservations via Resy!
📍Navy Blue @navybluehtx 
2445 Times Blvd
Houston, TX

Dishes pictured:
-Mussel Bisque
-Caesar Salad
-Baked Clams
-Stone Crab Claws
-Branzino

✨It’s Tamale Season✨
The holidays are here, which means it’s tamale season! Where can you order if you don’t want to make them yourself? Arnaldo Richard’s Pico’s. 

A Houston tradition for 38 years, choose 1/2 dozen, or full dozen. Norteños Style 3oz corn husk tamales (half dozen $10.50/full dozen $21) can be ordered with Pork in Red Chile, Chicken in Green Chile, Beed in Red Chile, Black Bean & Cheese, and Peppers & Cheese. Oaxaqueños Style 6oz banana leaf wrapped tamales (half dozen $21/full dozen $42) can be ordered with Pork in Red Chile, Chicken in Green Chile, Chicken in Black Mole, and Portobello Mushroom & Huitlacoche. 

Pickup/delivery, cold for reheating, or warm to eat right away - take your pick! I ordered four different kinds to refrigerate and heat up when I’m hungry and they were absolutely delicious!
📍Arnaldo Richards’ Picos
@picosrestaurant 
3601 Kirby Dr. 
Houston, TX 77098 
832.831.9940

✨Reserva de la Familia Tequila✨
Have you heard about Reserva de la Familia? A premium tequila by @josecuervotequila, the crown jewel is the extra anejo @reservadelafamilia, made from a barrel blend of the family’s private reserve selection, aged in American and French oak. The tequila is ultra smooth and deeply flavored, with notes of almonds, dark chocolate, vanilla, with an added depth of toasted oak aroma. 

I attended a special tasting in Dallas led by Maestra of Tequila, Sonia Espinola de la Llave (what a treat!) where she took us through a tasting of Platino, Reposado, and Extra Anejo! The event also unveiled 2023 artist-designed collector’s box (available in January) — inspired by the agave landscape & volcanic soil —and got to see the entire collector’s box collection dating back to 1995! Reserva de la Familia is one of the best premium tequilas the market and is a hidden secret among those in the know…#iykyk

✨Checking In…✨
Overnight getaway in Dallas! Stayed at the historic @lemeridienhotels @thestoneleigh in Uptown and was upgraded to a Junior suite because of my @marriottbonvoy Gold Elite status. The room was spacious with an old world feel, a giant pivoting TV in the middle of the room, with full walk-in closet and nice soaking tub. The public spaces on the landing floor were comfortable and welcoming. I didn’t have much time but I walked around the neighborhood and was tickled pink to see @uchidallas right next door. A very nice stay in Dallas. 
📍@thestoneleigh

✨Lady M✨
Chocolate Mille Crepe Cake
Just in time for Christmas! I got a chocolate surprise in the mail today! A chocolate mille crepe cake from Lady M, yum!

My cake came overnight in dry-ice, packaged securely in its very own Lady M carry bag. Inside, there were instructions on what to do (you have to let it thaw overnight before it’s ready). There were also cake decorations and a Lady M knife. 

As for how it tasted, I’ve only ever had the original before. They also have tiramisu, green tea, butter pecan and pistachio flavors, but I went with a classic chocolate, and it’s DIVINE. Like a classic chocolate mousse—so silky and creamy—a total foodgasm. The cake is $108 for a 9-inch sized cake, which is plenty. I cut mine into half (which can yield 6-8 slices, depending on the cut) and froze the other half for Xmas! 

@ladymcakes currently has a pop-up in the Houston  Galleria, but you can avoid the holiday craziness and order the cakes to be shipped to you or a loved one. Shipping usually requires a two-day advance purchase but they’re currently offering overnight shipping for orders placed by 3pm! 
📍@ladymcakes

✨Checking In✨
Winter vacation inspo: December just might be the perfect time for a getaway to Cabo! Sunny, beautiful 75-degree weather, spectacular sunsets, whale watching and beachfront cabanas await at the adults-only all-inclusive @pueblobonito The Towers at Pacifica!

Located within @quiviraloscabos private enclave facing the Pacific Ocean, a stay at the Towers gives you access to the ultra-exclusive cliffside golf course, Quivira Golf Club, four on-property restaurants, a gorgeous oceanfront bar & lounge with fire pits, plus free access to sister property Pueblo Bonito Sunset beach and all of its restaurants! 
📍@pueblobonito 
@quiviraloscabos

social_posts.post_text:
✨Whale sighting!✨
It’s whale watching season Cabo right now! The season runs through April and it’s such a thrill! I’ve seen several since I arrived in Cabo from the Whale watching lounge at my hotel — but during our sailing excursion with @cabo_adventures —arranged by our resort @pueblobonito @quiviraloscabos — we saw several. 

They say that when you see the tails like this, the whales are diving deep down and you won’t see them again for a while. So happy to catch a pair of whales right next to each other! (We saw a few others but this is the only thing I was able to capture on video). Have you seen whales irl before? 

#whalesighting #whaleseason #whalewatching #visitcabo #pueblobonitopacifica #quiviraloscabos #caboadventures #sailingexcursions #cabosanlucas #mexicanvacay #wintergetaway #travelwriter #traveldeeper

✨Feed Me Experience✨
Ever since I heard about it, I’ve been wanting to try @phateatery’s “Feed Me” experience. Priced at $48 per person (min of 2 ppl) it’s essentially a family-style chef’s tasting of 6 courses from the @phateatery menu. They take note of any allergies, preferences & special requests (similar to Omakase), and you don’t even have to open the menu! Just sit back and relax, wait for the food to arrive and they send stuff out - so easy and fun!

“Feed me” is customized to your party so that you leave feeling satiated and full. I had my family with me, and we lucky to be there while the chef has his Wagyu Rendang Beef Wellington, so we got to enjoy it! Our “Feed Me” menu:
1) Roti canai 
2) Shu mai with caviar
3) Sizzling tofu (always a stunner!)
4) Wagyu Beef Rendang Wellington
5) Snow pea leave with spicy Belacan
6) Chili prawns

@phateatery also recently got their liquor license so we enjoyed several cocktails, too! Lychee Margarita, Malaysian Sling, Vices, Pink Drink & Gin& Tonic, Phat Old Fashioned, had Asian-esque notes that paired really well with our food, so don’t skip the cocktails.
📍@phateatery
@katyasiantown

✨New Restaurant & Lounge✨
Debuting just last week, the latest hotspot to open in Houston is called Ciel. 

French for “sky,” Ciel was inspired by Saint-Tropez in the French Riviera, so it’s sexy, extravagant and fun. The upscale restaurant & lounge brings dress code enforced, chef-driven French-Japanese fine dining (caviar service, king crab, steak, seafood & sushi), with live entertainment, nightly DJ and bottle service. 

This is definitely a place to get dressed up for a night on the town! My girlfriends and went for GNO and had a blast! The food was amazing: Executive Joseph Geiskopf brings 23 years of experience, with stints at Noma, Restaurant AOC and Geranium in Copenhagen, L’Astrance in Paris, among others. Reservations strongly recommended, but you can always drop by for drinks at the bar as well. The wine list is still being finalized, but the cocktails are delicious and there are plenty of bubbles!🍸🥂🍾
📍Ciel Restaurant & Lounge
@cielhtx 
River Oaks, Houston

✨Garlic Noodles✨
I crave this! Garlic noods + Bo Luc Lac Vietnamese Shaken Beef! Super tasty. Totally addictive. Thanks to special delivery from Ong Jas Viet Kitchen in Pearland! If you’re in Pearland, and you haven’t tried them yet, get some and thank me later. You can also get the garlic noodles with shrimp or roast chicken. Nom nom.
📍@ongjas_htx 
11930 Broadway St Ste 140
Pearland, TX 77584

✨Vietnamese chicken noodle soup✨ 
Baby, it’s cold outside! Time for some chicken noodle soup, but make it Vietnamese! I have been eating a lot of pho ga lately but decided to change things up & go for egg noodle - bring on the Mi Ga! The thin egg noodles are the same as the ones you get in wonton noodle soup. Broth is a deliciously aromatic chicken broth. Very basic herbs (sweet basil, like, optional bean sprouts) on the side. A large bowl (pictured) is juts $9.99. You can get fancier versions with giblets and chicken wings for a couple dollars more! Hits the spot!
📍Dakao Restaurant & Bar 
Houston Asiatown 

#chickennoodlesoup #eggnoodles #vietnamesefood #vietnamesenoodles #noodsnoodsnoods #noodlepull #houston #houstonfood #foodies #forkyeah #beautifulcuisines #eeeeats #houstoneater #bestfoodhouston #htx #noodles🍜

✨New Restaurant✨
Easily one of the best new restaurants of the year! The Lymbar by chef David Cordúa recently debuted in the Ion Midtown, and I’m smitten! The gorgeous interiors by @gindesigngroup feel intimate and cozy, while sexy and Latin at the same time. It feels like you’re dining in David’s home, and that’s how he wanted it! On the walls, custom art by @vernoncalderaart, a bookcase filled with pictures of grandmothers and items of personal significance, with green foliage throughout and a bar that’s just inviting you to pull up a seat! 

The menu is shareable, pan-Latin/Mediterranean, with French & Lebanese influences. Highlights include the Peruvian-style ceviche, truffle twinkies, chicken ballotine, and the foie gras donuts, but don’t stop there: Bring friends and family, order a bunch of things to share! With live music on specific nights. 

Add this to your date night-GNO-holiday plans, it’s a hot one!
📍The Lymbar @thelymbar 
@theionhouston

✨Ramen + Yakitori✨
I’m all about noodles in the winter! Today felt like a ramen kind of day, so we headed to @toukei_izakaya for ramen and robata. Love the ribeye cap skewers and the meatballs with the egg dip (chicken hearts were kind of gamey). Tonkotsu ramen or Spicy black ramen for the win! They have a full bar with plenty of whiskey, too, and cocktails for $8.50 on Saturday night, what? Good times!
📍Toukei @toukei_izakaya

✨Vietnamese Lunch in Little Saigon✨
We have been going to Pho Quang Trung on Bolsa Ave for years. A traditional old-school Vietnamese pho restaurant, the menu is huge and perfect for family outings when you have a lot of people with different tastes. 

We always get the Bún chả Hà Nội. The pork patties are huge and flavorful, the meat is chargrilled with a good marinade, and the fish sauce is well balanced. The vermicelli noodles are nice springy, and the veggies are fresh! 

Another fave is the Phở áp chảo • Crispy Fried Phở, which we get with beef. Damn good I say! 

The Phở is solid with tons of topping, and the Cà Phê Sữa Đá is strong, sweet and creamy, 👍🏻👍🏻

The only downside is the parking. This restaurnt is located across the street from Phước Lộc Thọ Asian Garden Mall so the parking lot is always packed! 

Service is always pleasant and upbeat. I like that the restaurant takes pride in the food they serve. One of my family’s regular go-to’s. 

📍@phoquangtrung

Preparing for Vietnamese New Year’s with a visit to chợ Tết 2023 (Vietnamese Tet Market) at Phước Lộc Thọ @asiangardenmall with my family. They have fruit, traditional clothing, plants and flowers, decorations and money envelopes. 2023 is the Year of the Cat so lots of Money Cats on sale, too!

✨Lunch at Lulu’s✨
Finally made it to Lulu’s after driving by it often and thinking it’s the most adorable spot! And you know what? It is. Adorable, that is. The dining room is filled with light, making it just a lovely lovely lunch spot! 

Menu-wise, it’s Italian, so the food is homey and comforting. We had a delicious beet and Burrata salad, fried calamari, grilled Caesar, and couldn’t help but try 3 pastas—Pappardelle bolognese, carbonara, and lobster sachetti. If you like lobster, this dish is rich but to-die-for. And save room for dessert! The tiramisu is excellent!
📍Lulu’s
2518 Kirby Dr, Houston, TX 77019

✨KOOZA Cirque du Soleil x MAD Houston✨
Attended the preview kickoff event for KOOZA at MAD, An Act in Four Courses! The new four-course prix-fixe by chef Luis Roger is inspired by KOOZA and includes a choice of four courses for $70. It will be offered for the duration of the KOOZA residency in Houston.

Selections range from beet ravioli to calamari bocadillos, jamon iberico, octopus, steak, Spanish churros and more! 

**Best of all, if you attend a KOOZA matinee, you can get 50 percent off your KOOZA dinner. ** There’s an optional wine pairing as well. 

MAD’s amazing mixologists also make some of the best cocktails in the city, so make sure to order cocktails! Don’t miss the restroom either (great for walking selfies)!

KOOZA by @cirquedusoleil runs from Jan 25-March 5 under the big tent at Sam Houston Race Park. Tickets available at www.cirquedusoleil.com.
📍@mad.houston at @rodistrict 
4444 Westheimer Rd Suite C180, Houston, TX 77027

Reservations for MAD via @opentable

✨Dinner at MAD Houston✨
In addition to the KOOZA prix-fixe menu that runs now through March 25, MAD (named after Madrid - so it’s a Spanish restaurant) has streamlined their menu. Start with tapas like jambon iberico with pa amb tomaquet, the beet ravioli, beef tartare. Order a cocktail or two, or a bottle of bubbly cava. Then for the main course, paella! You can choose one of MAD’s creations or build your own. Our party let me do the honors so I built my own: Fideuà with cochinillo (seafood pasta with suckling pig) and it was FANTASTIC. Two compulsory selfies: one in the restroom selfie and one with the golden astronaut sculpture! 
📍@mad.houston

-Fideuà with cochinillo

✨Duck N Bao✨
If you love Peking duck and soup dumplings, @ducknbaohtx is a must! They have two locations, the one pictured here is in Memorial and it’s hiding in plain sight, a total hidden gem. Their other location is in Cypress.

The soup dumplings and Peking duck are both are fantastic! They also have a full menu of Sichuanese items like chili oil wontons and spicy crispy chicken. There's a full bar with an all day $10 happy hour menu, as well as signature cocktails made with top shelf. Finally, there’s a window where you can see the soup dumplings being made. Interiors are gorgeous - like an elegant Chinese tea house, so so lovely. Check it out, you won’t be disappointed!
📍Duck N Bao @ducknbaohtx
5535 Memorial Dr suite o
Houston, TX 77007

✨Gatsby’s Prime Seafood✨
Date Night
There are now three Gatsby’s in Houston: Gatsby’s Prime Steakhouse, Gatsby’s Prime Seafood and Gatsby’s Grill. This was my first time at Gatsby’s Prime Seafood and it did not disappoint!

The seafood tower is definitely a splurge, but so worth it. It comes with smoke for a great Instagram moment, so be camera ready! We had King Crab Legs (my favorite), lobster, giant shrimp, oysters, and stone crab. We also tried the deviled eggs, which is their signature appetizer, and then moved on to the mains. I had planned to order the Branzino and the DelMonico for a surf & turf meal, but our server sold us on a seabass topped with lobster and sliced NY Strip topped with jumbo shrimp. I barely saved room for dessert, a NY cheesecake with fresh Graham cracker crust so I took it home for later.

The dining room feels super luxe & is decked out with navy blue velvet booths, blue and gold wallpaper, and blue chandeliers. The music is energetic, so come prepared for the experience & make sure you dress the part! 
📍Gatsby’s Prime Seafood
1212 Waugh Dr, Houston, TX 77019

🧧 Chức Mừng Năm Mới 🧧 
January 22, 2023 is the first day of the Lunar New Year. In the Vietnamese zodiac, 2023 is the Year of the Cat (it’s a rabbit in Chinese). 

In Vietnam, New Year’s day is called Tết. As a Buddhist, we visit the temple on New Year’s eve to catch luck and bring it home with us, usually in the form of fresh fruit like tangerines. Women often dress up in traditional Vietnamese long dresses, or áo dài. There may be lion dancing at the temple. You can also pray to Buddha as ask for your fortune. 

In preparation for Tết, we buy flowers and fruit and dried fruits to eat with tea and to give as gifts. Red envelopes filled with money are also given to young ones. 

These are some of the Tết decorations that are available at Hong Kong Mall 4. 

To all my friends and family, and everyone reading this post, for the a year of the cat, I wish you health, peace, good fortune and prosperity. 
May all your wishes come true. 
May all your endeavors lead to success. 

Chức Mừng Năm Mới 🧧🌸💥 🐱 

#chúcmừngnămmới #lunarnewyear #yearofthecat #houston #htx #happynewyearofthecat #Tết #chinatown #houstonasiatown #asiatown #asianmarket #tếtmarket #vietnamesenewyear

✨New Speakeasy✨
The coolest new speakeasy just opened in Houston! It’s called Mèo, which means “cat” in Houston. To gain entry, you ring a doorbell next to a mural of a giant cat wearing a cowboy hat, and someone will let you inside. 

✨The vibe is cozy and chill. There are banquettes against both walls, round tables for two and a small lounging area, as well as traditional bar seats. 

✨The craft cocktails are delicious! We tried five: lychee gimlet, Meo G&T, Violet Hour, Salty Kitty (made with salted plum/li hing mui), and the NoName, a tiki-inspired cocktail served in a white kitty porcelain cup. So fun!!!

✨Chinatown’s Most Beautiful Restaurant✨
Tucked away in the Dynasty Plaza strip mall, Xiaolongkan is a hidden gem that is also the most beautiful restaurant in Chinatown.

The only Texas outpost of a famous hot pot chain from Chengdu in Sichuan, China, the interiors transport you to another place and time, with intricate woodwork, hand painted murals and colorful red lanterns.

Famous for the scratch-made broths, you can choose up to three of the four broths to enjoy in one sitting. Two of the broths are non-spicy & two are spicy. You can specify the level of spice but my suggestion is to start with mild. They don’t mess around with the spice, it’s hot! 

Ordering is a la Carte from a digital menu on your phone. It can get a bit overwhelming, so my suggestion is to start with your choice of broths, then go with the preset combos (beef/lamb), seafood, vegetable, and add from there. Note that there is a $2.99 per person snack bar charge, but it  gives you access to frozen drinks, sauces, kimchi, fruit, and Haagen Dazs bars, so it’s well worth it. They also offer a selection of halal meats.

Wanna go but have questions? Feel free to drop them in the comments & I’ll do my best to address your concerns. 
📍 @xiaolongkanhouston

✨Teide National Park✨
Fun fact about Tenerife: The island is home to more than 300 volcanoes. And Teide National Park, which  sits nearly smack dab in the center of Tenerife, is the place to go if you want to see them. 

A UNESCO world heritage site spanning 47,000 acres and Spain’s largest national park, the landscape is kaleidoscopic, fascinating and otherworldly — jagged rock formations of varying colors, peaks and valleys framed by a backdrop of the fourth tallest volcano in the world, Mount Teide. Utterly phenomenal. Add this to your bucket list, especially if you love nature and astronomy! The park is also famed for its observatory, and as a place for spectacular star gazing. 

Note: If you need a guide, our guide Dario of @tenerife_100_culturas was amazing. He also does sunset, stargazing/astronomy, and sunrise tours. If I ever go back it’s on my bucket list of things to do on the island.

✨Seaside Lunch on Tenerife’s West Coast✨
Tenerife is home to several Michelin starred restaurants but since it was my first time in Tenerife I really wanted to learn about the local food as much as possible. 

One of my favorite meals of the trip was at a seaside restaurant called Muelle Viejo, in the coastal town of Alcala on Tenerife’s West Coast, just 15 minutes south of the cliffs of Acantilados de Los Gigantes. 

The restaurant prepared us a set menu paired with exceptional Canarian wines from @bodegas_tajinaste. We sampled local white fish ceviche, tuna tartare, fish croquettes, and a crispy-skinned filet of a local fish called they called pompano (but it looked like something else— the chef brought one out for us to see), served with papas arrugadas, a local dish of salted potatoes with mojo sauce. We also tried a trio of local desserts, and I had my first #barraquito! It’s a Canarian coffee drink made with condensed milk, Licor 43, lemon zest and cinnamon - a must try!

The restaurant is located next to a turtle reserve & the vistas are spectacular so there are plenty of photo ops! 
📍@restmuelleviejo

Had the most amazing whale watching experience with @freebirdcatamaran which departs from Puerto Colon in Costa Adeje, Tenerife!

✨Le Jardinier Houston✨
One of the most beautiful restaurants in the city, Le Jardinier is located inside the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston’s new Kinder Building. 

French for “the gardener,” Le Jardinier earned one Michelin star in New York City, and offers modern French cuisine that’s tied to the seasons. Overseen by Culinary Director Alain Verzeroli, and helmed locally by chef de cuisine Felipe Botero Sanchez, patrons can choose between an a la carte or five-course seasonal tasting menu, with optional wine pairing. The wine and beverage program complements the menu, with beautifully crafted cocktails and a strong wine list overseen by two on-site sommeliers.
 
Designed with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the Cullen Sculpture Garden, there’s a beautiful tapestry by Trenton Doyle Hancock, as well as a dramatic ceiling light installation by Isamu Noguchi.

The restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. For the best views during dinner time, book a half moon booth before sunset. 
📍Le Jardinier @lejardinierhouston 
5500 Main St Suite 122, Houston, TX 77004

✨The Truffle Masters✨
In 2015, @drdelicacy held its first truffle competition and it was such a success that it’s become one of Houston’s premier annual food events! 

Going into the 8th year of this event, here’s a look at some of the the highlights from last year. Judges are tasked with scoring each dish on presentation, creativity, use of truffle, and taste. Taste is the most important! In the past it was weighted higher than the other categories, so it accounts for a bigger portion of the total score. A dish can be creative and beautiful but ultimately fall flat on taste. Wishing all the chef-competitors good luck! @thetrufflemasters 

#truffles #drdelicacy #thetrufflemasters #tartufonero #foodevents #houstonevents #houstonfood #htxfoodies #foodgasm #foodorn #beautifulcuisines #foodcompetition #foodies #foodandwine #houstonthingstodo #houston

✨The Truffle Masters 2023✨
I came, I ate, and ate, and ate more than 20 truffle dishes!

But alas, I couldn’t taste them all! This year there were 28 entries — too much for any single judge to taste — so the entries were split among two groups of six judges. Each group tasted 14 entries. The judging was done on a blind basis. We were given a description of the dish & nothing more. Dishes were judged on six criteria: 1) Use of fresh truffle 2) taste 3) execution 4) appearance 5) creativity 6) texture. We had five minutes to taste and score, so it was important for the entries to score well visually and on taste. 

For me, the simpler dishes stood out the most. My two favorite dishes of the night ended up being ones that I tasted when I walked the floor of the event — shoutout to Russell Kirkham’s @rgk318 foie gras torchon ice cream with truffle from Artisans, and Niki Vongthong’s @nik_v73 lao sausage dumpling in chicken & pork broth from Hidden Omakase! 

In the end, there could only be one winner. Congrats to all the chef participants on a tremendous effort and to the winning restaurants/chefs!
 
First Place: @noburestaurants Second Place: @masraffs 
Third Place: @artisansrestauranthouston 
People’s Choice: @musaaferhouston 

Until next year! @thetrufflemasters

✨Migo Saigon Food Street✨
One of my favorite spots for lunch is @migosaigonfoodstreet in the @bellairefoodstreet complex. Migo stands for “mì gõ.” 

“mì” are egg noodles. “gõ” means to knock. 

In Vietnam, they are a type of street food noodles sold by walking vendors who would walk around the neighborhood making knocking sounds to get your attention while yelling “mì gõ đây!” (“Egg noodles here! Come get your egg noodles!”) 

This street style noodle is very basic, consisting of thinly sliced pork, snappy egg noodles, and minimum garnish, usually fried shallots and fried bits of pork fat for flavor. 

At Migo here in Houston, I like to get the dry style Migo with the broth on the side. Sometimes I’ll get a side order of wontons to eat with it, and I always get the street corn (trust me it’s tasty). I also get the Vietnamese egg coffee, made to order with an organic egg whipped by hand until foamy, airy and delicious! 
📍Migo @migosaigonfoodstreet 
9393 Bellaire Blvd Suite H, Houston, TX 77036

✨Spicy Bone Marrow✨
:: Limited quantities available daily::
Every now and then a dish comes along that’ll hit you in the solar plexus. This one definitely did it to me. 

This is the spicy bone marrow appetizer from Resilience Viet Kitchen in Houston’s energy corridor.

They take bone marrow that has been simmering in their house pho broth for 20+ hours, they scoop it up and add spices and all kinds of magic, and then they roast it the oven. It’s served in a cast iron skillet with thinly sliced baguette, and all you have to do is scoop and enjoy! 

I’m told that there are only limited quantities of this available every day because the bone marrow yield is quite low after it’s been cooking for so long, so call to reserve your order or come early in the evening because they do run out. Seriously though, you want this!
📍Resilience Viet Kitchen @resiliencehtx 
1140 Eldridge Pkwy #190, Houston, TX 77077

✨New Vietnamese Restaurant✨
There’s a gorgeous new Vietnamese restaurant & bar in the energy corridor called Resilience Viet Kitchen.

A concept by the owners of Pho Binh in the Heights, the restaurant offers a mix of traditional and modern Vietnamese dishes. 
We enjoyed everything from the egg rolls to the lamb chops, crunchy garlic shrimp, shaken beef, and short rib pho, not to mention their crazy good spicy, bone marrow appetizer, which is only offered in limited quantities.

✨Healthy Vietnamese Cuisine✨
If clean eating and local sourcing are a priority for your lifestyle then you have to check out Lua Viet Kitchen in Montrose.

Located on West Alabama at Mandell just a few blocks away from the Menil Collection, this fast casual spot offers healthy interpretations of Vietnamese food. 

There’s no added MSG, they’re attentive to allergies (using peanut and gluten free sauces); there are substitutions options for dairy, and they offer an extensive vegetarian menu. 

The owners pride themselves on using locally sourced products  and vendors, from @44farms beef, to @redbirchfarm free range chicken, @lucecoffeehouston roasters, Admiral shrimp from local fisheries, and more. 

It’s fast casual counter service, but the space is super adorable, with a beautiful mural, a striking canopy of chandeliers, and a comfortable outdoor patio. If you’re in the area, definitely check it out! 
📍Lua Viet Kitchen @luavietkitchenhouston 
1540 W Alabama St UNIT 300, Houston, TX 77006

✨Chinese BBQ Plate Lunch✨
Cash & Carry

This is a two-item, Chinese barbecue plate at Wing Kee. Wing Kee is a Cantonese restaurant but they also have a small Chinese barbecue stand. 

Everything is Cash and carry so make sure that you bring cash.

Wing Kee is an OG Houston Chinatown spot, very reliable and consistent. From the regular menu, they also have the best soft scrambled eggs with shrimp!

✨New Pakistani Restaurant✨
Karahi Boys just opened a new location in Sugar Land and it’s easily the most attractive Pakistani Restaurant in the city.

Walking through the doors, you’re greeted by the sight of a copper piped chandelier sculpture, beautiful furniture, murals and art. 

A successful mini-chain from Toronto, Karahi Boys makes everything fresh to order. Their claim to fame are the karahis, cooked over high heat in a round iron pot (similar to a wok).

✨Vietnamese Chả Cá✨
Turmeric Fish with Dill & Noodles

Chả Cá is a famous northern Vietnamese dish of white fish marinated in turmeric and galangal, fried and served over copious amounts of dill. The dish is served deconstructed with rice vermicelli noodles, herbs and puffed rice paper on the side. You assemble all the main components in a bowl and finish with a drizzle of sauce (usually a sweet & savory sauce with pineapple and fermented shrimp paste that’s full of umami).

It’s healthy and light and has a very unique flavor. Try this version at Thien Thanh on Bellaire Blvd, one of Travel + Leisure’s picks for eating like a local in Houston, and one of the best and oldest traditional Vietnamese restaurants in Houston Chinatown. ✨bring CASH✨
📍Thien Thanh
 11210 Bellaire Blvd, Houston, TX 77036

✨New Hong Kong Dessert Shop✨🥭🥥
We visited the new Hui Lau Shan dessert shop in Dun Huang Plaza today and it was crazy-packed! 

The dessert shop opened in Hong Kong in 1960 and is famous for its handmade mango and coconut dessets. I loved the mango mochi, coconut pudding, mango pancake, durian pancake, and the chewy balls with mango dessert! 

Everything is refreshing and cool and not too sweet. We ordered the jumbo A1 to share but it’s so hot outside that it melted quickly. If I did it again I’d order the smaller size instead. 

Everyone in Houston seemed to be there today so if you want to try the new Houston dessert hotspot, head to Dun Huang Plaza. The lines were long but service was upbeat and quick, so it wasn’t that long of a wait.

✨New Summer Omakase✨
Aya Sushi just dropped their new summer Omakase menu and it’s delicious! You can choose between regular and premium Omakase —we had the premium, which was a total of 23 courses that included chef’s creations, sushi, sashimi and dessert.

Highlights include chef’s creations like crab tempura with wasabi aioli, sea bass nitsuke, sashimi tara with pineapple and miso fog (beautiful and delicious), toro uni sashimi, Ezo Bafun Uni sushi, as well side-by-side sashimi and sushi tastings that featured summer seasonal fish like ivory king salmon.

Chef Yoshi-san was wearing his signature pink outfit and was dancing throughout the night, so this added to the fun. The sushi bar is also intimate, spacious, and quite beautiful — one of my favorite in the city & a great choice for date night!

✨Houston’s Best Push Cart Dim Sum✨
::Saturdays & Sundays until 3pm::

Where to go for weekend push cart dim sum? In Houston, Fung’s Kitchen is the place to be. 

On the weekends, the restaurant offers push cart dim sum from open until 3pm. They open up all of their banquet rooms so there are about 1000 seats, all of them occupied, with everyone happily feasting on dimsum. 

There are many dim sum restaurants in Houston but they don’t carry the breadth of dishes offered here — in total more than 100 dishes, from your traditional har gow, shu mai, chicken feet and fried shrimp balls, to specialty steam plate items, such as the braised to pig’s trotters in black vinegar, a Chinese Delicacy filled with collagen that is supposed to help with postpartum recovery. 

i’m always impressed by the mouthwatering display of pushcarts, carrying everything from traditional steamed dim sum to fried dim sum, vegetables, char siu, cold chicken, cheung fun rice noodles, congee, tofu pudding, dessert, and more! 

Speaking of dessert, save room for dessert & make sure you order the crispy lava buns, my personal favorite. The lava buns always sell out so when I get an order i feel like I won the food lottery.
📍Fung’s Kitchen @fungskitchen 
7320 Southwest Fwy Ste 115, Houston, TX 77074

Vietnamese shrimp & crab tapioca noodle soup.

Porchetta is an Italian dish of crispy skinned boneless rolled pork. When it’s done well, the skin achieves a shattering crispness, while the insides are moist and melt-in-your mouth tender.

✨Best Spa in Mexico?✨
I’ve been to many, many spas all over the world, but I was honestly blown away by Muluk Spa at Hotel Xcaret Arte! 

Floating through the hydrotherapy circuit was like swimming in a private Mayan oasis. The water was crystal clear water in varying shades of aquamarine. ✨Khao Mun Gai Thai Chicken & Rice✨
Finally had a chance to try Rooster & Rice at the The Stomping Grounds in Garden Oaks! It’s one of the only places in Houston that I know of that specializes specifically in this dish of Thai chicken and rice called Khao mun gai, or Khao man gai (ข้าวมันไก่).

The spot itself is fast casual & primarily takeout with just a few bar seats, but there is ample seating in the grassy courtyard outside, where kids are usually running around and having a grand time. 

Rooster & Rice started in San Francisco where they have several locations! I tried The Original chicken and rice, which comes with dark and white meat chicken, rice, dipping sauces and a side of broth; The Cutlet, which is a fried breaded chicken cutlet that also comes with rice, sauces and broth; and the Hat Ya Fried Chicken which comes with rice, sweet chili sauce and cucumber. 

Everything is homey & comforting and can be shared family style or as a meal in itself! If you’re near Garden Oaks, check it out!

✨Best Chinese Roast Pork✨
OK guys I have a new place for you to try if you wanna get legit crispy skinned Chinese roast pork! 

This place is called Hong Kong BBQ, and it’s located on Bellaire Boulevard in the Ai Hoa shopping center, between Dakao & Hai Cang in Houston Asiatown/Chinatown. 

The owners are a Chinese-Vietnamese family which means you can come and speak both languages! 

The Chinese barbecue master has more than 30 years experience making Chinese barbecue (he used to be at Long Sing) and his roast pork is just beautiful.

Roast pork is $9.75/lb; roast pork belly is $11.50 a pound, and combo plates are still only $9.25, a steal! Whole pigs start at $260 for 15-20lb. The pictured whole roast pig is 35 pounds and $320; must place whole pig orders 3 days in advance. 

Check out this family owned mom and pop hidden gem! Save this post & thank me later!

✨Best Pho in Houston?✨
Is this the best bowl of pho in Houston? The Pho Fix started out as The Pho Spot in Conservatory downtown food hall several years back. They gained a reputation for their rich family recipe broth and melt-in-your-mouth high quality beef toppings.

Newly opened @stompinggroundshtx, @thephofix definitely delivers on a delicious bowl of gourmet-style pho. 

This bowl is called “The Supreme” and is their premium bowl. It comes with a beef rib, oxtail, bone marrow, your choice of herbs and to vegetable toppings, choice of pho noodles, and of course @dannyphofix’s secret family recipe Southern Vietnamese pho broth. 

It rings in at $22, but it’s a beautiful bowl! The bone marrow adds a fatty richness while the beef rib and oxtail are tender and flavorful. 

The Pho Fix also has build your own bowls, chicken pho and vegan pho — more on that later! But if you want to try one of the best bowls of pho in Houston, definitely bookmark this place!

The Pho Fix is a fast casual restaurant where you choose your toppings and watch everything being prepared in front of you. Parking is spacious, free and plentiful, and the air-conditioning system works great!

✨Reza Persian Grill✨
OK guys this place has become one of my regular go-to spots it’s called Reza Persian Grill and it is a Persian restaurant that specializes in kebabs. 

You can get all kinds of kebabs here, beef, kebabs, lamb, kebabs, ground chicken, and chicken breast….

Everything I’ve had is good. The hummus is amazing. The complimentary flatbread is also really delicious.

But the reason I go are the kebabs! I used to get the combo kebab plates, but lately I’ve been obsessed with the beef koobideh, which is the ground beef kebab. The seasonings are perfection and the beef is so juicy and delicious. I’ve been getting that every time. 

I also get the combo koobideh which comes with one beef one chicken kebab.

The restaurant recently remodeled so it’s more spacious and clean and very family friendly, there’s always huge groups of families here. They open till 10pm on most nights and 11 PM on Fridays and Saturdays. And I highly recommend to take out the kebabs— they come in these giant takeout containers so the experience at home is just as good as experience in the restaurant. 

Without a doubt one of the best Persian restaurants in Houston and definitely my pick for best kebabs right now.

✨Chinese BBQ✨
If you’re looking for traditional Chinese barbecue in Houston, give this place a try. It’s called Hong Kong BBQ & it’s located in the Ai Hoa shopping center between Dakao & Hai Cang. 

The barbecue chef used to work at Long Sing Market in east downtown Houston for 28 years before it closed. He’s had this shop for five years which means he has more than 30 years experience making traditional Chinese barbecue. 

The prices are super reasonable and this place is still very much under the radar and a hidden gem. The combo rice plates are a bargain and ring in at $9.75 for a 2-item combo with one vegetable item. 

My favorite was the roast pork, but of course try it for yourself and see what you think! This place is mostly take out, but there are four tables if you want to dine in. It’s a family run mom and pop shop and they speak Vietnamese, Chinese, and English.

✨New Seafood Restaurant✨
Hey Y’all there’s a new seafood restaurant on Westheimer called Nauti Crab! They’re actually a successful restaurant from New Jersey, but they recently opened i. Houston and are still under the radar!

The specialty here is the garlic roasted Dungeness crab, but the restaurant offers all kinds of seafood, including the Cajun style seafood boils, crab rolls, lobster and more.

This restaurant is on my regular rotation. It is a traditional southern Vietnamese restaurant. 

The specialty here is Cơm tấm, or Vietnamese broken rice, so you can get a variety of broken rice plates with different types of toppings of your choice.

✨Vegetarian Bún Riêu✨
Bún Riêu is one of my favorite Vietnamese noodle soups of all time. It’s a northern Vietnamese dish traditionally made with pounded crab that curdles and floats to the top of the broth forming floating crab paste called “Riêu.” The broth is usually chicken and/or pork based consommé with tomato for color and acidity.

This Vietnamese vegetarian version is excellent. I usually get it at the temple or at san san tofu, which is a Houston tofu house and also a fast casual vegetarian spot in Chinatown. The vegetarian version comes with tofu and tomatoes, mushrooms, and veggie shrimp in a veggie broth tinged with sesame oil. It’s a beautiful dish, super hearty, and currently rings in at an affordable $11.25 for a very generously portioned bowl. 

Try it if you love Vietnamese food even if you’re not vegetarian — trust me it’s delicious.
📍San San Tofu
6445 Wilcrest Dr, Houston, TX 77072

#noodlepull #vietnamesefood #houstonfood #foodies #vegetarian

✨BEST BUTTER CROISSANT IN PARIS?✨

My search for the best butter croissant in Paris brought me here to La Maison d’Isabelle. 

Located in the Quartier Latin at the Maubert - Mutualité Metro stop, this bakery won 1st place for the best butter croissant in Paris and Ile-de-France in 2018. 

It’s strictly takeaway, and there are usually people in queue but it moves quickly. 

The croissants are made with organic flour from Moulins de Breaseuil, and Charentes-Poitou AOC organic French butter from Laiterie Pamplie dairy farm. 

On weekends, they have a takeout counter where the croissants are baked to order and are served warm, straight from the oven. They proudly display the trophies at the entrance, and inside there is a mouthwatering display of patisserie.

I tried five other croissants in Paris and this one was the winner by a mile. In fact, none of the others even came close. 

In conclusion, if you love croissants and want to a taste of what is arguably one the best croissants in all of Paris, I highly recommend  La Maison D’Isabelle! 

Their butter croissant costs just 1,30 euro, is exceptionally flakey and delicious, and will make a wonderful memory for your visit to Paris.

📍La Maison d’Isabelle
47ter Bd Saint-Germain, 75005 Paris, France

#croissants #foodies #foodreview #parisfood #parisjetaime

✨Rue Mouffetard✨
One of the oldest Street in Paris, Rue Mouffetard or “La Mouffe” is lined with shops and vendors, and is a beloved Parisian market that is well known for its numerous gourmet shops. 

Located in 5ème in the Latin Quarter, it’s a lovely place to spend a morning in Paris, especially on weekends. On Sundays there is dancing and singing at the Saint Médard chapel. 

You can walk around to pick up gourmet finds like cheese and patisserie, or find a spot at La Mouffetard for drinks and people watching. 

Open daily except for Sunday afternoons and Mondays .

✨The best fromage de tête✨
Fromage de tête, or head cheese, is one of my favorite types of charcuterie. It’s a type of cold cut made with select cuts from a pig’s head held together in a savory aspic meat gelee. So many versions of this are tasteless and boring, but I found one that kind of blew my mind at Charcuterie Saint Germain in Paris’ Latin Quarter.

This small artisanal charcuterie shop is one of those hidden gem finds that’s a joy to discover! They actually won the grand prize for the best Fromage de tête in France in 2019, and I have to say that the head cheese completely lived up to the hype. 

The shop specializes in housemade charcuterie from sausages to terrines, and is a perfect place to drop in for gourmet picnic finds. I ordered one tranche of fromage de tete and one tranche of pate de champagne for about 11 euros, a steal!

Charcuterie Saint Germain is located on the same terrace as La Maison D’Isabelle and other gourmet shops in the 5ème arrondissement at the Maubert-Mutualite Metro stop.
📍Charcuterie Saint Germain
47 Ter Bd Saint-Germain, 75005 Paris, France
Metro Maubert/Mutualite

#charcuterie #fromagedetete #parisfood #foodies #bestfoodinparis

✨Birthday Lunch!!!✨
Where do you go for a fabulous lunch in Houston? I don’t get to come here often enough, but Ostia Houston is one of my favorite spots. 

It’s in Montrose and the food is very Californian in style—which I do so love. Chef Travis McShane is a native Houstonian but he worked for Jonathan Waxman (a pioneer in Californian cuisine), so everything is farm to table fresh & beautifully plated and delicious. The garden room also boasts an excellent Soundsystem and I give an A+ to whoever was in charge of the music. A perfect birthday lunch! Thank you for the memories!

✨A Day at the Museum✨
When I have a day to myself, nothing makes me happier than visiting the museum. In Houston, I’m an avid patron of the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston!

✨New Korean BBQ Joint✨
All-you-can-eat 

There’s a brand new Korean barbecue joint in Houston Chinatown/Asiatown called Garosu Korean Barbecue. 

They offer all-you-can-eat Korean barbecue for lunch and dinner, and let me just say that you’re gonna leave extremely happy and full. That said, expect to do all the cooking yourself! This is not one of those places where they do the cooking for you. 

The owners are Korean and the kitchen staff are Korean, so the flavors are really authentic. 

For lunch, they offer a limited menu for 24.99. 

For Dinner, they offer three price points: 
A. 29.99
B. 35.99
C. 43.99

We got the C menu because it has the most options for beef cuts, including Black Angus ribeye steak, New York Strip & more. But honestly, most people are going to be satisfied with the B menu, which offers core meat selections such as prime brisket, marinated galbi, & house special bulgogi, along with all of the seafood choices (shrimp, octopus and squid), and several options for chicken and pork. 

The restaurant offers just 7 banchan to start, but there are so many appetizers (unlimited) so it’s hard not to over order! We tried  japchae, soondubu jjigae (soft tofu stew), spicy tteokbokki, gyeranjjim(steamed egg), ramen, haemul pajeon (seafood pancake), tempura shrimp, and Doenjang jjigae (soybean stew), but there was so much more I wanted to try, from the Korean fried chicken to cheese corn, fried mandu, cold tofu, tonkatsu, and more. 

Overall, for an all-you-can-eat Korean Bbq place, the meat quality was excellent. My favorites were the prime brisket, Wagyu beef belly, and marinated galbi. But the great thing about all-you-can-eat is you can try a bunch of different things to find what makes sense for you. 

Bonus: The restaurant is still BYOB, but they do charge a service fee. It’s $6 for a six pack of beer, $7 for small soju/sake, $15 for large soju/sake and $20 for wine. 

📍Garosu Korean BBQ
@garosu.kbbq 
11700 Bellaire Blvd Suite A, Houston, TX 77072

#newrestaurant #kbbq #koreanbbq #houstonfood #foodies

There is a new hidden gem mom and pop Vietnamese restaurant in the father part of Chinatown on Bellaire Blvd near Synott. 

It’s called Claypot Kitchen or Cơm Niêu Houston, and it specializes in iconic Southern Vietnamese dishes cooked in clay pot, from crispy clay pot rice, to caramelized catfish in clay pot.

Mademoiselle Louise is owned by a French couple, Chef-owner Frederick Fortin and his wife Syvkhen. The bakery is named after Fortin’s grandmother Louise.

✨Date Night at Truluck’s✨
Florida Stone Crab season kicked off last month and will run through May. If you’re looking for the best Florida Stone crab claws in Houston, look no further than Truluck’s!

For more than 30 years, Truluck’s has been synonymous with the best stone crab claws in Houston! In fact, the original founders purchased a Florida fishery specifically so that they could bring Florida stone crabs to Houston. 

If you’ve never dined at Truluck’s before, it’s definitely a treat. This is one of those places where you can get dressed up for a fancy date night and indulge in really delicious, high-quality seafood and steaks. 

Service an absolute joy - it’s professional and old school, where everything is taken care of for you, and you don’t have to lift a finger. 

Aside from Stone crabs, the menu features a variety of fresh seafood, from the most delicious lobster bisque I’ve had in ages, to house specialties like miso glazed seabass over crab fried rice, or build your own surf n turf with choices like lobster, king, crab and scallops with your choice of prime steak. A la carte sides like lobster mashed potatoes complement the meal.

And save room for dessert. Their Carrot cake just might be the best carrot cake you’ve ever tasted. 

And pro tip! If it’s a special occasion, or if you ask very nicely, you might be able to get your server to get you their flaming baked Alaska! The Westheimer location also has all-you-can-eat stone crab claws on Monday nights only. 
📍Truluck’s 
5350 Westheimer Rd, Houston, TX 77056

✨New Premium Omakase✨
Join me on a 17-course culinary journey at Nobu Houston, which is now offering a premium omakase experience at the sushi bar. Longtime Japanese sushi chef Eiji Saito (Saito-San) oversaw the entire experience, which was exemplary from start to finish.

Offered on Thursdays and Fridays, Nobu Houston’s new premium omakase takes you deep into the world of Nobu Houston, where you’ll taste classic and elevated expressions of Nobu-style cuisine. 

The 17-course menu is arranged into flights, starting with appetizers of hamachi jalapeño, Imperial caviar taco, and Kyushu oyster. Then comes the sushi parade, starting with an incredible bluefin tuna flight of akami, Hagashi toro, and bincho-tan kissed o-toro. 

You’ll get to sample lighter fish flavors like tai, kanpachi, and Hokkaido scallop, moving on to rich and full courses like salmon belly, Japanese barracuda Aburi, and creamy baked crab; ending with a flourish of decadent courses like Japanese A5 wagyu hand roll, lobster miso soup, and Hokkaido uni atsuyaki tamago. The final course is a whisky cappuccino dessert. 

The omakase is offered at $225 per person, with an optional sake pairing ($70), definitely a splurge, but worth it!
📍Nobu Houston
5115 Westheimer Rd Suite C-3515, Houston, TX 77056

✨Viral Ramen Spot in Houston✨
I finally had a chance to check out Kyuramen in Chinatown! It’s a viral Ramen house with 120+ locations, famous for their innovative honeycomb seating & interior design. The Houston location opened in March but when they opened there were 3 hour wait times. 

These days if you go during the week the wait times are not bad at all. In fact, I was seated immediately and I got a booth all to myself on the third floor of the honeycomb! 

Kyuramen specializes in traditional Japanese Ramen. On their website it says that the Kyushu Tonkotsu Shio is the typical ramen, so that’s the one I ordered. You get a choice of white garlic or black garlic (+$1) and I choose black garlic. You can also upgrade with a combo for $6.99 and that will get you a pork bao and a Thai iced tea.

There’s a call button for service, which was fast and efficient. The Ramen itself was really delicious, though the portion is somewhat small for the price ($16.99). That said, I finished the entire bowl and slurped up all the broth so I thought it was worth it! 

Pro tip. If you check in on yelp, they’ll give you a free dessert, and if you want the honeycomb seating, I suggest coming early. It’s definitely a fun and unique experience, and 100% will go again, because I want try their insta famous omu rice!
📍Kyuramen Houston @kyuramen.houston 
9126 Bellaire Blvd, Houston, TX 77036

✨New Thai Restaurant✨
Makiin is a stunning new Thai restaurant that just debuted on the ground floor of Hanover River Oaks.

One of the most beautiful new restaurants to open in Houston, Makiin is an ambitious new project by restauranteur Lukkaew Srasrisuwan, who also owns Kin Dee in the Houston Heights.

In Thai, Makiin is an invitation which means “come and eat.” The restaurant is helmed by co-chefs Eakkapan Ngammuang (Chef O) and Aphassorn Predawan (chef Bell), who bring years of experience with authentic Thai cooking.

Makiin brings a sophisticated approach to traditional Thai dishes, using a combination of local sourcing, straight-from-Thailand herbs and spices, and culinary creativity to create dishes that are a feast for the eyes as well as the senses.  
We sampled several items but highlights include the duck salad, wagyu khao soi (crispy and soft noodles in curry), tom kha gai (coconut chicken soup), tomahawk pork chop stuffed with Thai sausage, and the shrimp pad Thai (terrific)! 

Desserts are all house made and incredible as well! Bookmark Makiin for your next night on the town! 
 📍Makiin @makiinthai 
2651 Kipling St Ste 101, Houston, TX 77098

✨Vietnamese Brunch✨
OK guys if you are in the Little Saigon area of Orange County, there’s this really cute Vietnamese brunch place you need to try called NEP. They’re open daily at 8 AM until 3 PM and 4 PM on weekends. 

I’ve come here a couple times before and the reservations are really hard to come by but good news. They now have OpenTable so it’s really easy to get a reservation. 

I booked a table straight off the plane coming in from Houston, and before we knew it, we had a beautiful breakfast brunch spread on the table. We ordered two of their famous sizzling platters -  bánh mì chảo filet mignon, bánh mì chảo  bò kho (beef stew), a chicken salad, crab toast, and egg coffee. Service was upbeat and friendly and the food was excellent on the whole! (Make sure to ask for the filet mignon medium rare, though, mine was overcooked).

✨The coolest bowl of pho✨
I love me some pho. When I saw the spot on Instagram, I immediately bookedmarked and made plans to check it out. 

This place is called Pho Flavor. They just opened in Garden Grove California earlier this year. Garden Grove is in the heart of Southern California’s Little Saigon area, home to the largest population of Vietnamese in the country.

The restaurant is a traditional pho house. The menu is quite simple. They offer two styles of pho: northern or southern. You can choose the house specialty (dac biet), which comes with a set number of toppings, or you can build your own bowl with the toppings that you want. 

We all ordered the northern style dac biet (special) bowl. I also got a side order of oxtail and a side order of the egg (highly recommend). You can also get a side order of beef short rib, or a side order of bone marrow, but they were out of the bone marrow when I was there. 

The northern style pho was delicious. I got mine with the rare on the side. Each bowl came with a ton of toppings! The meat quality was excellent. The noodles were fresh and silky. My mom was with me and she kept on saying how good it was, especially for the price. The specialty bowl was only $12.99 and came with seven types of meat! 

One other thing that’s really special here besides the bowls. When you sit down, the server will come with a bottle of fresh basil. The bottle is decorative and you can also just break off the basil to garnish your pho. At the end of your meal you’re welcome to take it home as their gift to you. 

I really loved this pho place. I would definitely go back! They’re planning on opening a new location in fountain Valley in the next few months. If you’re in the area, I highly recommend it! The next time I am back in Orange County I will definitely revisit! 
📍Pho Flavor @phoflavor 
10130 Garden Grove Blvd #131, Garden Grove, CA 92844

✨Trung Nguyen Legend Cafe✨
The first US location of Trung Nguyen Legend cafe, a legendary Vietnamese coffee producer with more than 100 coffee house locations in Vietnam, recently opened on Bolsa Ave in the heart of Little Saigon in Westminster California. 

Of course I had to check it out. 

When I arrived, there was a long line that moved quite slowly.  Inside, there’s a large community table with limited patio seating outside. Both areas were packed. 

The decor is kind of Vietnamese colonial coffee house glam, with dark woodwork reminiscent of turn of the century Vietnamese architecture, hanging lanterns in the shape of a Vietnamese straw hat,, and French-European artwork (think: Marie Antoinette). 

It took me a good 20++ minutes to place my order and receive my cup of Vietnamese egg coffee. 

While I was waiting, I browsed some of their retail items and picked up a box of their Vietnamese blend filtered coffee, which comes in their own filters and is so cute. 

This Vietnamese coffee house serves phin- and espresso-based coffee drinks using 100% Vietnamese-grown Robusta and Arabica beans from Buôn Ma Thuột, a city in Vietnam’s Central Highlands. 

The signature Vietnamese egg coffee was thick and creamy, if a little sweet for my taste. But the underlying flavor of the coffee is very distinctive, and it was very smooth. Next time I think I’ll just have the Phin (traditional filtered) coffee. 
Bookmark this & definitely check it out if you love coffee! ☕️
📍Trung Nguyen Legend Cafe
9039 Bolsa Avenue #101, Westminster, CA 92683

✨Korean Restaurant in Garden Grove✨ 

Did you know that some of the best Korean food in Southern California can be found in Garden Grove ? Garden Grove California is home to a large Korean enclave. You’ll find an H Mart there and tons of Korean restaurants there. 

Jong Ro Sulleontang has been around for almost 30 years, but I only just discovered it during my last visit to Orange County. 

The restaurant is a classic Korean mom & pop restaurant with a very large menu made of mostly Korean soups and stews and a few specialty items. (It’s not a Korean bbq restaurant).

It was my first time there, so we ordered some of their specialty soups as well as one of my favorite Korean dishes of all time, braised Korean short ribs, or galbi jjim (with cheese).

The galbi jjim was spectacular! They dont set the cheese on fire like they do at Sun Nong Dang in LA, but the short ribs were large and braised to perfection. The sauce amazing, and we used scissors but it was finger licking, fall off the bone tender.

For soups, we got the galbi tang short rib soup, the gamja tang spicy pork bone neck soup, and the sulleontang, the restaurant name sake, which was a milky broth, oxtail and brisket soup. 

We also ordered the bo ssam (pork belly wraps) because I love bo ssam.

We loved everything, but especially the galbi jjim.

Service was warm and friendly, and I loved seeing the Korean community enjoying the food. There were families, couples, friends, eating — everyone looking super happy and just enjoying everything. We went for lunch so when we arrived, it wasn’t too busy, but it started to get really full and I am told that dinner is quite busy. 

Bookmark this for the next time you’re craving Korean! 

📍Jong Ro Shul Lung Tang
8942 Garden Grove Blvd ste#114, Garden Grove, CA 92844

✨Igloo Dining Experience in Houston✨
Want to do something super cool and fun this holiday season? Book your own private igloo dining experience at the Marriott Marquis Houston. 

It’s called the Gastrodome, and it’s an igloo pop-up dinner experience located on the sixth floor rooftop at the Marriott Marquis Houston during Texas Winter Lights. This igloo pop-up dining experience accommodates up to 10 people at a time.

✨Vietnamese Dinner✨
Where do you go when you’re craving Vietnamese food ? 

Claypot Kitchen or Cơm Niêu Houston, has become one of my go to spots in Houston for Vietnamese cuisine. The restaurant specializes in Southern Vietnamese dishes cooked in a clay pot, like caramelized catfish in clay pot, or shrimp braised in clay pot. 

The menu is very large and designed to be shared family style. I recommend going with a small group or family so that you can order several things to share. 

I’ve tried a good portion of the menu, and I always seem to come back to their classic Vietnamese braised clay pot dishes. 

This time we tried the shrimp braised in clay, but I do think the traditional catfish ca kho to in clay pot is better. 

The canh chua sweet-and-sour Fish soup is fantastic. It is served in a small pot over a portable burner so that it’s kept hot. I recommend fishing out the fish early on so that it doesn’t get overcooked. 

Their bo luc lac shaking is delicious too! Very tender and tasty - one of the best I’ve had in Houston!

So there you have it—one of those hidden gem, under the radar restaurants and a regular go-to spot for when I am craving Vietnamese food.
Bookmark to try if you love Vietnamese food!

📍Clay Pot Kitchen - Cơm Niêu Houston
13080 Bellaire Blvd Suite A, Houston, TX 77072

✨Korean BBQ in Ktown LA✨
It’s become an annual tradition. Pretty much every time I visit Los Angeles, I go to Ktown LA. 

And every time I go to Ktown LA, I want or crave Soowon Galbi. 

There are so many choices in Ktown LA, and I’ve tried all the popular ones, but I always end up going back to Soowon Galbi. It’s definitely a place where if you know you know! 

The restaurant is named after a very famous town in South Korea and is known for its Galbi or marinated short ribs. We’ve come here and ordered the combos, which are good if you don’t know what to order, but just do yourself a favor and make sure you get yourself an order of Soowon Galbi, because you’ll be fighting for it. It’s juicy, tender, and full of flavor—for me, some of the best and most memorable Korean BBQ I’ve had in the states. 

The restaurant always serves us an interesting and delicious assortment of banchan side dishes. I’ll usually order their gyeranjjim (steamed egg), and another appetizer like the haemul pajeon seafood pancake or japchae glass noodles. And of course beer or soju! 

They don’t take reservations, so you have to go in and physically put your name on a list and wait, but it’s worth it.

Bookmark this if you want to try real deal Korean BBQ in Ktown LA! 

📍Soowon Galbi

✨Hot Stone Pot Pho✨🍜
Have you seen the new trend called hot stone pot pho? It’s Vietnamese beef noodle soup, or pho, served in hot stone pot, with the noodles, meat and veggies on the side. 

There’s a new restaurant in Garden Grove, California called Hot Stone Pho that is now serving this hot stone pot pho.

 They offer a short rib, oxtail or the dac biet, or special version, which comes with six types of meat. Each bowl rings in at about $18.95, which may seem pricey, but they give a ton of food.

The restaurant is modern and spacious and they also serve regular pho as well, but the hot stone pho is the way to go.

✨Chả Cá Thăng Long✨
Vietnamese turmeric fish with dill 

Chả Cá Thăng Long is a famous specialty from Northern Vietnam. In fact, there’s an entire street in Hanoi that dedicated to this specialty, Vietnamese turmeric fish with dill. The English translation is not exact, but representative of the main ingredients used to make the dish.

There are several versions of this dish. In Vietnam, at some places, you actually will fry the fish at the table. Here at my family’s favorite restaurant in Little Saigon, Westminster, California, the fish is served on a sizzling platter, and topped with copious amounts of dill, fried shallots and peanuts. 

It’s a spectacular rendition and the best of the versions I’ve tried anywhere.

The dish is served in a deconstructed style, with rice vermicelli, fresh herbs & lettuce, crispy puffed rice paper, and a pungent, sweet and savory sauce on the side. You assemble all the ingredients in a bowl and enjoy as you go! 

Song Long Restaurant has been my family’s favorite restaurant for the better part of three decades. It’s a mom and pop hidden gem and a local treasure — one of those all time essential greats. I hope you get to try this spectacular dish if you visit Orange County! 
📍Song Long Restaurant 
@songlongrestaurant 
9361 Bolsa Ave, Westminster, CA 92683

✨A Perfect Morning✨
Need ideas for a dreamy vacation? I recently visited Montecito California, which is in California’s central coast just outside Santa Barbara, and spent a dreamy couple of days at the most incredible hotel, the Rosewood Miramar. 

This Forbes Travel Guide five-star hotel is located right on the beach, literally steps away from the waves. 

This is a snapshot of my first morning there, which was so so dreamy, and so perfect. 

I woke up at dawn to walk on the beach and catch the sunrise: pure heaven. 

After breathing in the exhilarating ocean air, watching the surfers run by, and just letting myself live in the moment while watching the waves crash near my feet, I return to the hotel for breakfast at the Michelin recommended Revere Room.

Because it was still early I snagged the best seat in the house in the founders room—an unbelievably picturesque nook nestled beneath a chandelier, and overlooking a flower bed. 

I then indulged in one of the best hotel breakfasts ever, starting with a lavender latte made with syrup of house grown lavender, to the most amazing butter croissant I’ve ever had in a hotel, smoked salmon and decadent eggs Benedict. 

Replete from a magnificent meal, I return to my room, where I don my plush robe, crawl back into bed, and enjoy nature with a bit of champagne. 

If you haven’t ever been to Montecito, this is a dream destination. Santa Barbara and this area in the central coast is often compared to the French Riviera. And the Rosewood Miramar is not only a dream but a foodie’s dream with some of the best hotel dining I’ve experienced anywhere! 

Bookmark this spot for your next California getaway!

✨Best Hot Pot in Houston✨
As temperatures dip below freezing, it’s time for hot pot. 

And the best spot in Houston? Xiaolongkan. (Pronounced “shao -long-kahn”).

Located in the Dynasty Plaza in the heart of Houston’s chinatown, Xiaolongkan is part of a famous hot pot chain from Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan China. The restaurant is known for its high quality ingredients, stunning presentation and beautiful interiors. 

I love this place because I can’t handle a lot of spice, and they have a selection of delicious house-made broths (tomato, chicken with fish maw, pork) that are non-spicy. 

I also adore the interiors. There’s no place else in Houston like it. It’s like walking into a Chinese movie set and sitting down to dine, now how cool is that? 

The restaurant is very small and intimate with just 16 tables. They don’t take reservations, so if you come during peak times, prepare to wait. I like eating early so at 5 PM I had my choice of tables! 

Xiaolongkan has à la carte pricing and they recently reduced prices by 20% on every menu item, so if you haven’t been in a while, it’s time to go back.

Note that the restaurant is ideally suited for groups of 4 to 10. Anything beyond that and it’s very hard to accommodate.
📍Xiaolongkan
9600 Bellaire Blvd #102A, Houston, TX 77036

✨Ramen + Yakitori in Houston✨
Toukei Izakaya is one of my favorite spots in Houston for ramen and yakitori. It’s owned by Mike Tran, the restauranteur behind places like Mein, Aka Sushi, and Tiger Den. The vibes are super cool and trendy and I like that it’s open late night on most nights until 1 AM (it’s closed on Mondays).

The menu is mostly Japanese small plates, including ramen and robata items from the grill, small rice bowls, and appetizers that are meant to pair well with alcohol.

Toukei has a really impressive whiskey collection, a full bar, excellent and affordable cocktails (most drinks less than $10!) as well as its own Suntory Toki whiskey highball machine, so if you’re looking for some late night ramen or some small bites with drinks to go with, you know where to go!

✨Cutest sushi takeout✨
OK guys, I had the cutest sushi takeout the other day at Himari at The Stomping Grounds in Houston’s Garden Oaks neighborhood.

The place is tiny with a sushi bar and just a handful of seats. They have a full bar with excellent cocktails, and a very good whiskey selection.

Pictured is the sushi set B, which comes with two pieces each of five types of Nigri sushi, three pieces of a choice of sashimi, and Hamachi hand roll. We also had a really great Hamachi appetizer, as well as a melt-in-your-mouth torched Wagyu sushi. They have other sets as well and of course you can also order à la carte.

Himari is the third sushi concept from the guys behind Kokoro sushi at the Bravery food hall, and Aiko on Washington, and Handies Douzo.

If you’ve never been to The Stomping Grounds, it’s this cool retail complex that’s home to several locally owned restaurants. In the middle of the stomping grounds is a spacious lawn with colorful Adirondack chairs. You can bring your kids and your pets and you can enjoy your meal and your alcoholic drinks outside! 
📍Himari 
At The Stomping Grounds 
1223 W 34th St C500, Houston, TX 77018
